page.title: 05The Villages - TURVILLE
page.content: TURVILLE is by far the most attractive, a typical English Village, about 45 homes around the church and circular village green. Most of these are old though there are a few post-war council built houses. The Vicarage is modern. At the rear of the village is the derelict school closed in 1984. The village is dominated by a ridge to the north on which stands a renovated wind- mill Â£Cobstone Mill'. The name has been variously recorded through the years - Thyreferld - Turfield -Â£a dry open field'. On the side of a barn is a war time plaque Â£Air Raid Warden's Post'. The 13th. century church is dedicated to St. Mary the Virgin, and is built of flint. Although many families in the district have their own horses, the Riding Stable is the centre of increasingly popular horse riding.
